div.span: "Ludlow Independent Schools. Every Student. Every Day."

During our school closure, we want to remain connected with you! Please continue to check in with us through your teachers, our social media outlets, our webpage and mobile app, and our Grab & Go ...
Read More

div.a: Preschool & Kindergarten Registration - Complete Brief Online Form

span.p: For Those Wishing to Register Students for Preschool or Kindergarten for 2020-2021: Please click the link below and complete the few questions asked.Â You will then be contacted by a staff member to assist you with the registration process.Â With school closed, we had to cancel our in-person registration event, but we still want to help each and every one of you byÂ answering all questions you have!Â We're excited to meet our future little panthers!

div.a: Seniors: Apply for Local Scholarships! Due April 27

span.p: Seniors: Spend some time applying for any local scholarships for which you are eligible.Â Read through our LOCAL SCHOLARSHIPS PAGE to access the scholarship packet and each application.Â All applications are due by April 27thÂ to Pam Johnson.Â Email them to her at pamela.johnson@ludlow.kyschools.us

div.a: Follow Our BOOK OF THE DAY! Teachers Share a Story Each Day

span.p:
Ludlow Students: Stay connected with us!Â We want to make sure you keep reading each day while weâre out.Â Weâll post a video of one of us reading to you each day!Â View the BOOK OF THE DAY in the morning, afternoon, or as a bedtime story, but please just keep reading (or listening).Â We miss you!Â
Click Read More below for our videos...

a.title: Click to read more about: Follow Our BOOK OF THE DAY! Teachers Share a Story Each Day

div.a: Read More about Follow Our BOOK OF THE DAY! Teachers Share a Story Each Day
NTI Work Posted on Teacher Webpages

span.p:
Beginning April 13th, all NTI assignments will be posted on each teacher's webpage.Â Teachers will still use other means of communication for check-ins, but this will be the one, steady place where parents and teachers can go to see assignments for the week.Â
How can you find teacher webpages?Â Click on the dropdown menuÂ at the top of our webpage for each school.Â You will see "Teacher Webpages" listed under each school.Â You can also access them using our mobile app!Â Download "Ludlow Independent Schools" from your mobile app store, then click on "Faculty and Staff".

div.a: Coronavirus Closure & NTI Days - Updated on April 3

span.p: Please take a few minutes to watch Superintendent Mike Borchers' video messageÂ to Ludlow Families.Â Also, read our latest LETTERÂ that provides some importantÂ details.Â CHeck out our WE MISS YOU video too!

div.a: Grab & Go Menu While School Is Out
Fun & Enriching Activities to Try at Home!

span.p: Parents, we've put together this collection for you to explore and find lots of fun and engaging activities for you and your kids of all ages!Â Click on the link in each offering to take you to that fun experience.Â Explore a new one each day!Â
Click Read More to see our list!

a.title: Click to read more about: Fun & Enriching Activities to Try at Home!

div.a: Read More about Fun & Enriching Activities to Try at Home!

span.p: The 2020-2021 District Calendar has been approved by the Board of Education.Â Mark your calendars with theseÂ important dates!

div.h1: Ludlow High School Receives National Recognition!

p.span: Congratulations to the students, faculty, and families of Ludlow Independent Schools!Â Ludlow High School was awarded a BRONZE MEDAL from U.S. News & World Report in 2018!Â That ranks us in the Top 29% of school nationally, and in the Top 23% in Kentucky!Â Way to go, Panthers!

strong.em: The Ludlow Independent School District is committed to fostering a culture
of rigor, excellence, and personal accountability
by developing meaningful relationships with students, families, and community members
to support and empower students to graduate with college and career readiness skills.

div.p:
"In an effort to ensure the safety of our students and faculty, please report any threats to our students or school by clicking the S.T.O.P icon. This will direct you to Homeland Security's National Hotline. Be advised. False accusations and false threats are a very serious offense."
Â
